climbs.name: Agent Smith
climbs.fa: Josh Shewbridge, Kate Trecartin and Eric Samis

content.description:
The crux is probably down low on the lower angled slab part.  Not a lot of gear here.  The upper half of the route is really fun.

Last clean line on the right of the Matrix wall.  Start anywhere on the right or move up a bit and start right next to a small Spruce.
Single rack to 3".  Tree anchor.

climbs.name: Bending Spoons
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Valerie Anctil and Nick Brake, November, 2021

content.description:
A good intro to slab climbing. A low angled crimp fest. 



Located on the right hand side of The Matrix. Look for four bolts on the first slab you encounter. 

4 bolts, bolted anchor

Crux is probably the steeper part at the bottom.  A fun little route, worth doing despite the length.

To access this climb gain the ledge above Mr. Anderson and you will find a short wall with two prominent cracks in the middle. Ascend the vertical crack on the right to the top.
Standard rack, mostly small gear.  Purple tcu works nicely to protect against a run out.

Crux is halfway up on this face holds between the horizontals.  Nice climbing on gorgeous stone.

Just left of Agent Smith and right of Mr. Anderson.  From the base look up for an orange triangle where a flake broke off.  Climb straight up to the triangle and above.  Rap off the station on the left of the wall.
Single rack to 3".  Very little protection on this route.

climbs.name: Dozer
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Brooke Ashley and Dom Caron

content.description:
Trust those feet! Slab climbing with mostly small holds on the first 25 feet. Bolts protect run outs and the crux moves then it is good gear to the top. The upper part after the ledge is very easy. A good first lead for new trad climbers.

Last route on the right hand side of the Matrix Wall. Start is just down and right of the first bolt.
Three bolts, tree anchor, rap the route or step up to the ledge and rap one of the bolted rappel stations.

climbs.name: Follow the White Rabbit
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Denise Hamel and Shawn Bethune

content.description:
The crux is probably just getting established in the first part of the crack and getting a piece of gear in.  Very nice jamming sequence throughout.  You can easily combine this with the top half of The Oracle which makes for a really nice link up.

The start is just left of Trinity on a wide ledge.  Look for a gorgeous left trending diagonal hand crack.  Climb the crack until it runs out finishing at a small tree on the left side of the wall about half way up or continue up the vertical crack (The Oracle) to the top of the wall.
Standard rack of nuts and cams.  It would be wise to double up from .5 to #2 camalots.

climbs.name: Morpheus
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Mike Parker, Mike Delaney

content.description:
Generally good crack climbing on a quality stone.  Some consider a move about a third of the way up to be run out.  Otherwise excellent gear.

This route and the next four are all located at The Matrix Wall on the far left hand side of the cliff.  Look for the clean line on the left hand side of the wall directly below a large spruce tree (third tree on the left) at the top on the climb. The start is on a small ledge down and left of the main ledge that has the massive spruce tree. Climb up through a blocky section to gain a fist crack. Follow this straight up through a series of cracks until you reach a right trending ramp. Continue up the ramp to reach the ledge on top. Descend via the rap station on the ledge.
A standard rack to 3.

The crux is about midway on the climb in a thin crack above a horizontal ledge.  Some consider the bottom part of the climb hard to protect but the climbing is low 5th class.

On The Matrix Wall look for a twenty foot high slab in the shape of a triangle. Several starts are possible including a low angle ramp on the left. Climb up on top of the triangle to a ledge that will eventually lead to a prominent finger crack. There are two possible cracks close together that can be climbed.
Standard rack to 2".  Mostly small gear for the business of the climb.  TCU's work well.  One bolt protects a run out on a slab.

climbs.name: The Oracle
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Lucas Toron, Kristy McClellan

content.description:
Begin on a short low angle slab that leads to an overlap. Pull the overlap and continue up on a gorgeous hand crack that will make you wish it was longer. After gaining a couple of small ledges the route steepens near the top and the crux. Finish up on the big ledge, build a gear anchor on the short headwall above and belay the second. Save a few finger sized pieces for the gear anchor.

Located on the far left hand side of the Matrix Wall. The start is down and left of the big ledge where the Matrix wall sign is. 
Standard rack, maybe double up on camalots from .75 to #2. Bolted anchor.

climbs.name: Orange Shirt Day
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Amy Cao and Charly Bonga, September, 2021

content.description:
A fun adventure route on nice quality stone.



Around the corner to the left of the Matrix you will see a giant roof. The route starts below and right of the roof. 

Single rack to 2" piece. Bolted anchor on the Matrix Wall ledge.

This is a fun little climb on vertical and horizontal cracks.

To access this climb gain the ledge above Mr. Anderson and you will find a short wall with two prominent cracks in the middle. Ascend the vertical crack on the left to the top. Walk off to the left or rappel off the spruce tree.
Standard rack.  Tree anchor.

climbs.name: Tank
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Brooke Ashley and Dom Caron

content.description:
Both Tank and Dozer would be good first climbs for the aspiring trad leader. There is good protection throughout, nice movement on good rock. When you get to the tree ledge you step left then up to stay totally on rock the whole way. There are three different ways you can do the crux at the second bolt. 

Second last route on the right at the Matrix Wall. Tank is the line just left of the spruce tree on the ledge midway up. If you look on the face above the tree you should see two protection bolts.
2 bolts, tree anchor, rap the route or move up to the ledge and use the bolted rap station.

This route is the second route on The Matrix.  On the main ledge locate a small cedar tree directly in front of the massive Spruce tree. The climb begins in a crack just left of the Cedar. Climb up through a series of cracks until you reach a right trending ramp. Continue up the ramp to reach the ledge on top (this climb shares the same finish as Morpheus). 
 Note: There is also a direct finish that goes straight up to the spruce tree to the left. It goes at about 5.8 with small gear.

Single rack to 3". Bolted rappel station. Rap the route.
Enter a description of this area.
